news_header: Caffè Nero has acquired the independent coffee house chain 200 Degrees, which operates 21 stores across the UK.
news_text: 200 Degrees, an independent coffee house chain based in Nottingham, has been purchased by Caffè Nero. Established in 2012, the chain has expanded to 21 locations throughout the UK, including cities like Manchester and Cardiff. With its own roastery in Nottingham, 200 Degrees becomes the fifth brand under the Nero Group, which plans to further develop the brand while allowing it to operate independently. Nero Group CEO Gerry Ford emphasized the brand's loyal customer base and regional strength, while 200 Degrees managing director Stephen Fern expressed excitement about the growth potential within the Nero Group.
